data.title: Clients and Transactions
data.text:
In addition to providing general corporate counsel, our clients benefit from industry-specific transactions. The following lists a selection of our attorneys' current and/or prior clients and representative transactions. Please select an industry to view the applicable representative transactions.

Semiconductors

Software and Other Technology

Internet Technology and Infrastructure

E-Commerce and Content

Energy and Conservation

Venture Capital

SEMICONDUCTORS

Magma Design, NexGen (acquired by AMD), Sonic Blue (formerly S3), ZSP

Representative Transactions:

Digital 5 - Joint DSP technology development agreement with Zoran

Sonic Blue - licensed audio-related technology from SRS, Dolby and other companies that Sonic Blue incorporated into its PCI-based audio chip

G2 Networks - Gigabit Ethernet chip development agreements

Magma Design - Multimillion dollar sales agreements with Hitachi, Sun and others

NexGen - Technology development agreement with international semiconductor leader

ZSP - sales representation and distribution agreements for DSP chips

SOFTWARE AND OTHER TECHNOLOGY

Alchemedia Technologies, Ashlar, Digital 5, Digital Fuel, Instant802 Networks, Keri Systems, Lyris Technologies, Rebis, SRI, Stanford University

Representative Transactions

Alchemedia - All software license and support agreements; OEM agreements, including integration with RSA Security's BSAFE (encryption) technology; Reseller and distribution agreements with Adobe, Akamai, SPSS and OpenText; Strategic alliance agreements with Oracle and Lotus/IBM.

Digital 5 - Overseas manufacturing agreements; OEM agreements with leading consumer electronics companies including Thomson and Philips; Intellectual property counseling to help launch leading MP3 and other consumer electronics products

Lyris - Acquisition of SparkLIST.com that closed in August 2002; Revenue generating contracts, including enterprise and consumer software license and distribution agreements; Enforcement of confidentiality agreements.

Rebis - VAR and distribution agreements for CAD/CAM software

INTERNET TECHNOLOGY AND INFRASTRUCTURE

Adaptive Media (renamed Vuent), Aptimus, Best Internet, Deluxe Digital Media, Internet Devices (acquired by Alcatel), InTouch Group, NETCOM, Network Solutions Inc. (NSI), SoftCoin, Xpedior

Representative Transactions:

Adaptive Media - codec technology licenses from Lucent, and technology licenses to Microsoft and Netscape.

Devicescape - incorporation, Series A financing, in-bound technology agreements, distribution agreements, and other corporate and technology transactions.

Aptimus (formerly XMarkstheSpot)- All revenue generating agreements, including over 100 technology services agreements and strategic alliance agreements, and all vendor contracts.

PacketHop - spin-off from SRI, and all technology licensing agreements.

SoftCoin - Technology services agreements with Procter & Gamble, Kraft Foods, Verizon Wireless, and Frito-Lay with an aggregate value exceeding $7M; Strategic alliance agreements, including with AOL.

Xpedior - technology development agreements with companies such as MCI and Forte

AboveNet, NETCOM, Best Internet and other ISP/hosting companies - all agreements required to provide ISP services including equipment leases, co-location agreements, network services agreements, consumer services agreements, acceptable use guidelines, web site hosting agreements, advertising agreements and network peering agreements.

E-COMMERCE AND CONTENT

Abilizer, Birkenstock, Briefing.com, SmartAge, PeopleSupport, Pointcast, Remarq (acquired by Critical Path)

Representative Transactions:

Connexus (Netblue) - Advertising counseling, advertising agreements, and service agreements.

SmartAge - E-commerce agreements, content licenses, and strategic alliances including agreements with AOL, 24/7, AT&T, CommTouch, DoubleClick, Excite@Home, Go (Disney), NetObjects, Screaming Media, Virtual and Communities; Technology licenses including agreements with Art Technology Group, Oracle and Unisys.

ENERGY AND CONSERVATION

PowerLight, Environmental Defense, Destination Conservation, Rainforest Action Network

Magenn Power.

PowerLight - Commercial contracts including direct sales agreements, VAR, distributor, affiliate and subcontractor agreements and and government contracts (with value exceeding $1.3M).

Rainforest Action Network - Managed extensive trademark licensing program.

VENTURE CAPITAL

Allen & Bruckeridge, DeviceScape (formerly Instant802 Networks), Sonic Blue, SmartAge

Allen & Bruckeridge - Venture investments into companies as part of spin-offs from Philips and other companies.

DeviceScape - represented company in Series A financing from August Capital and Kleiner Perkins Caufield & Byers that closed in September 2002..

SmartAge - Series B ($7M led by Accel Partners), Series C ($40M led by Softbank).

Sonic Blue - private placements tied to licenses in companies including Faroudja and Intervista.
